etymology.description: 入(入) (rù, "enter") + 一(一) (yī, "one") = gathering from three sides -> gather
etymology.interpretation: The character 亼 combines 入(入) (rù, "enter") and 一(一) (yī, "one") to convey the idea of things coming together from different sides, similar to the concept of gathering. Its connection to ancient 集(集) (jí, "gather") strengthens this meaning.

examples.chinese: 在古书(在古書)，这个字很常见。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔshū, zhège zì hěn chángjiàn.
examples.english: In ancient books, this character is very common.

examples.pinyin: Jí chūxiàn zài yìxiē míngzì lǐ.
